SEARCH
Package game

Class StateManager

java.lang.Object
game.StateManager
public class StateManager extends Object
Holds game state data, including layout and player info. Additionally, provides methods to save/load the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • StateManager

      public StateManager()
      Instantiates the game. begin() should be called before reading fields.

  • Method Details

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Initializes and starts the game. Should be called right after construction.

    • getCountdown

      public Countdown getCountdown()
      Returns the active turn counter.
      Returns:
      The turn counter.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Replaces the active player with a new one.
      Parameters:
      player - The new player.

    • setCountdown

      public void setCountdown(Countdown countdown)
      Replaces the active turn counter with a new one.
      Parameters:
      countdown - The new turn counter.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns the active player.
      Returns:
      The player.

    • getRoom

      public Room getRoom(String name)
      Gets a room by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The room's name.
      Returns:
      The room.

    • getRooms

      public HashMap<String,Room> getRooms()
      Returns a hashmap of all rooms.
      Returns:
      All available rooms.

    • getCommand

      public Command getCommand(String name)
      Returns a command by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the command to get.
      Returns:
      The command, or null if not found.

    • getCommands

      public Command[] getCommands()
      Returns an array of all commands.
      Returns:
      All available commands.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns whether or not the game should be running.
      Returns:
      True if game is running, false otherwise.

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame()
      Quits the game.

    • calculateEnding

      public int calculateEnding()
      Returns one of the constants [END_*], depending on which ending state the game is currently in.
      Returns:
      The ending state.
